snippet: By the time Mr. Roof, accused in the Charleston shootings, was in high school, he struggled with his classes, took drugs and had run-ins with the police.
abstract: Investigators say Dylann Storm Roof, accused of killing nine people in Charleston, SC, church in June, struggled with his classes in high school, took drugs and had multiple run-ins with police; Roof, who has not entered a plea in his trial set to begin on July 11, 2016, could face death penalty if convicted.

byline.original: By FRANCES ROBLES and NIKITA STEWART
byline.contributor: Chris Dixon contributed reporting from Columbia, S.C., and Anthony Cave from Cudjoe Key, Fla. Kitty Bennett and Susan Beachy contributed research.

lead_paragraph: By the time Mr. Roof, accused in the Charleston shootings, was in high school, he struggled with his classes, took drugs and had run-ins with the police.

headline.main: Dylann Roof’s Past Reveals Trouble at Home and School
headline.print_headline: A Church Shooting Defendant With ‘a Darkness to His Life’

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church (Charleston, SC)
